snippet: Analysts say that fighters who have joined the struggle against President Bashar al-Assad could reinvigorate militant movements in Indonesia when they return home.
abstract: Report by Institute for Policy Analysis of Conflict says that Indonesians have joined thousands of foreign fighters who have traveled to Syria to help extremists groups trying to create an Islamic state there; analysts say finding could help revive a weakened jihadi movement in Indonesia and set off more attacks on minority Shiites in the country.
lead_paragraph: Analysts say that fighters who have joined the struggle against President Bashar al-Assad could reinvigorate militant movements in Indonesia when they return home.

headline.main: Indonesian Militants Join Foreigners Fighting in Syria
headline.print_headline: Indonesian Militants Join Foreigners Fighting in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
